nodes.bodyText: should also have 503 and 500 - https://github.com/eclipse/microprofile-health/blob/master/spec/src/main/asciidoc/protocol-wireformat.adoc#status-codes

Thanks @xstefank - I'll add those.
W.r.t experimental paths, I am easy, I do not really have an opinion on that. Maybe @knutwannheden can comment here as this is requested by him.

I don't understand what you mean by "experimental paths", but from my perspective it is only important that the path of every endpoint, which gets called by another service, is registered with the Azure API management. Having the API responses described is not necessary, but of course a nice to have!
@knutwannheden sorry, I meant experimental features paths, e.g. /health/group/{name} or /health/well. I guess if you are not using them, it's not necessary, just asking for completeness.
Maybe this should be more specific? Like OpenAPIFilterBuildItem?

I'm wondering if it needs to be super specific to what we're actually doing.
Though what's being included is an implementation of OASFilter, maybe the build item should be something like IncludeEndpointInOpenAPIDefinitionBuildItem? I know, very wordy, but elaborates what it's for
Also maybe an OASFilter is just an implementation detail understood by the OpenAPI extension. I wonder if this build item shouldn't just contain the data (Endpoint path, etc)
Something like AdditionalOpenAPIEndpointBuildItem
Ken made the same comment, I'll go with his very specific suggestion (IncludeEndpointInOpenAPIDefinitionBuildItem)

Granted I don't know if this would work.
But could the spi dependency be optional and then use a different build step method that is only "used" if OpenAPI extension is actually present?
I am not sure how to do this. asking on zulip...

@kenfinnigan - not sure if it's possible to do this at the moment. I think with some changes to BuildItem we can maybe do something like @BuildItem(ifInluded=Capability.SMALLRYE_OPENAPI), but I don't want to make that change as part of this PR or without consulting first. What I did in the mean time is to add SmallRye OpenAPI to the capabilities and do a normal isPresent against it when deciding to add the endpoint. Let me know what you think

I have not looked at the code, sorry. But I have one question regarding potential future additions of the same kind: Will other Quarkus extensions be able to contribute additional entries to the OpenAPI document for the application without requiring changes to the OpenAPI extension. While I don't regard this as a requirement, I think it would be nice to have or at least for the design to allow for this evolution.
Yip, other extensions can now just use the build item to contribute
Oh, I see. You did end up moving the config flag to the health extension. This looks very much like what I was hoping for 👌
Interesting that this works, I always thought we had to use simple types and build the object when the build item is consumed
Not sure about that. But the test in Heath is working and creating the Document so at least it's working in test.

Not a deal breaker, but wondering if there's a better name?
Maybe "openapi.included"?
To me, "openapi.enabled" doesn't really embody what happens

      */

nodes.bodyText: Changed
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -10,4 +10,10 @@
      */
     @ConfigItem(name = "extensions.enabled", defaultValue = "true")
     public boolean extensionsEnabled;
+
+    /**
+     * Whether or not to include the Liveness and Readiness Health endpoints in the generated OpenAPI document
+     */
+    @ConfigItem(name = "openapi.enabled", defaultValue = "false")

nodes.bodyText:
I think this should be in a separate build step that means it is more easily not included if OpenAPI isn't present.
Can something like this be done: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/extensions/micrometer/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/micrometer/deployment/MicrometerProcessor.java#L58
Cool, made it a separate method.
Does it work if the OpenAPI SPI dependency is optional?
